comments.body:
While the TEST_CLUSTER_LOG_LEVEL totally make sense, I'm not sure about this one.

KUBE_GCE_INSTANCE_PREFIX serves as kind of obligatory parameter that should be set by user. It allows you to set the "name" of the cluster, in a way that if you set a different names for two different start-kubemark.sh invocations, you'll get two different kubemark clusters, while if the name is the same the second call would most likely fail.

If we set the default for it, we should at least document that if you want to set up two kubemark clusters with different "names" you should change this env per each start-kubemark.sh invocation.

Thanks, you are right. I've added the document.

PS: Previously, the name was defined by 

> INSTANCE_PREFIX="${INSTANCE_PREFIX:-"default"}"
MASTER_NAME="${INSTANCE_PREFIX}-kubemark-master"

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@# If you want to set up multiple kubemark clusters with different "names",
# you should change this env per each start-kubemark.sh invocation.
KUBE_GCE_INSTANCE_PREFIX="${KUBE_GCE_INSTANCE_PREFIX:-"default"}"

# NUM_NODES is used by start-kubemark.sh to determine a correct number of replicas.

comments.body:
The majority of variables in this script come up as [SC2034](https://github.com/koalaman/shellcheck/wiki/SC2034) or _"foo appears unused. Verify it or export it."_ 

With that I think it's safe to just disable the check for the entire script.
yeah this is a wonderful "config script" that configures another script by setting envs. ðŸ™ƒ

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +20,24 @@# are enabled by default should not run in hollow clusters, they should be disabled here.

# shellcheck disable=SC2034 # Variables sourced in other scripts.

source "${KUBE_ROOT}/cluster/gce/config-common.sh"

comments.body: why are we changing the default network name for non-test clusters to "e2e"?
Oh, no sorry, scratch that. It actually is a test cluster - it's kubemark setup.
Oh, this is in the kubemark directory. Got it.
